jleechan2015
jleechan2015 commented 50 minutes ago • 
Summary
Modified claude_mcp.sh to handle pip packages alongside npm packages
Added special handling for claude-slash-commands-mcp package installation via pip
Enhanced package existence checking for both PyPI and npm registries
Updated global installation checks to differentiate between pip and npm packages
Built PyPI-ready distribution packages for future global deployment
Problem Solved
The MCP slash command server was only working in directories where the local virtual environment was active, causing connectivity issues in other Claude Code CLI instances.

Solution
Enhanced Installation Script: Modified claude_mcp.sh to detect and handle pip packages
Package Registry Detection: Added logic to check PyPI for pip packages and npm for npm packages
Global Command Wrapper: Created wrapper script for system-wide availability
PyPI Distribution: Built proper distribution packages ready for PyPI publishing
Test Plan
 Verify claude_mcp.sh handles pip packages correctly
 Test package existence checking for both registries
 Confirm global wrapper script works across directories
 Validate PyPI distribution package build
 Test MCP server connectivity in other directories
Technical Details
The script now supports both npm and pip package types:

npm packages: Use npm view and npm install -g
pip packages: Use pip show and pip install
Command execution: Uses direct command for pip packages vs npx for npm
🤖 Generated with Claude Code

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Added Python (PyPI/pip) installation path for claude-slash-commands-mcp alongside npm.
Simplified setup: use direct “claude mcp add … claude-slash-commands-mcp” command.
Enabled parallel batch installation for claude-slash-commands-mcp.
Chores

Improved registry checks and global install detection across Python vs Node paths.
Expanded logging with clearer success/failure messages and errors during install/add flows.

Pull Request Overview
This PR adds global installation support for the claude-slash-commands-mcp package by modifying the installation script to handle pip packages alongside npm packages. The main goal is to resolve connectivity issues where the MCP slash command server only worked in directories with active virtual environments.

Enhanced the installation script to detect and handle pip packages using pip commands instead of npm
Added special package detection logic to differentiate between PyPI and npm registries
Created proper command execution paths for pip vs npm packages

@cursor cursor bot 46 minutes ago
Bug: Local Install Check Fails Remote Package Existence
The PyPI package existence check incorrectly uses pip show. This command only verifies if a package is locally installed, not if it exists in the remote PyPI registry. As a result, packages available in PyPI but not locally installed are reported as 'not found', preventing their installation. This behavior is inconsistent with the npm view check.

Additional Locations (1)
